sense.name: Communicate or signal to with a flag, possibly with the intent to stop (someone).
sense.commentary: Includes: FLAG DOWN Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] FLAG (down) NP2[patient] NP1[agent] FLAG NP2[patient] PP{P NP[location]}
sense.examples: Let's flag down a cab - it's starting to rain. Flag a police officer if you can. The officers flagged the airplane into the hanger. Passengers flagged a following train to stop.

sense.name: Mark as important or relevant with a flag or as if with a flag.
sense.examples: Flag that file for future reference. She flagged the suspicious files. The IRS frequently flags high-earners for review.

sense.name: Droop, sink, or settle from or as if from pressure or loss of tautness; become less intense.
sense.examples: The market flagged early Thursday. Our enthusiasm for the course slowly flagged. The run flagged toward the end of the race, falling farther and farther behind the leaders.

sense.name: Decorate with flags.
sense.examples: The building was flagged for the Fourth of July.
